entry.title: Fiddling in the Park brings in youth to participate in music and community
entry.summary: While youth orchestras teach children crucial fundamentals and how to closely follow sheet music, there's not always an opportunity in them to cut loose and play without the fear of missing a note or perfecting a solo.

entry.title: Red Flag Warning in effect Tuesday
entry.summary: DOUGLAS COUNTY — A Red Flag Warning is in effect Tuesday from.1-9 p.m. for parts of southwest and south-central Oregon.

entry.title: Days Creek Charter School opens for new year
entry.summary: DAYS CREEK — Days Creek Charter School invited students kindergarten through 12th grade back to school Monday.

entry.title: RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT TUESDAY 1:00 P.M. to 9:00 P.M.
entry.summary: August 26, 2025 4:00 a.m. A Red Flag Warning is in effect Tuesday from.1:00 p.m. to 9:00 p.m. for parts of southwest and southcentral Oregon. The National Weather Service said abundant lightning on dry fuels will result in the potential for numerous new fire starts. The Warning area includes the Southern Oregon Cascades and the...

entry.title: FINAL DAY OF COOLING RESOURCE CENTER IN DOWNTOWN ROSEBURG
entry.summary: August 26, 2025 3:50 a.m. With temperatures forecast to moderate slightly, Tuesday is the final day for the Cooling Resource Center in downtown Roseburg. The facility had over 70 guests on Monday, which was a record. Organized by the Schlueter/Greenwalt Foundation, the center is at Saint George Episcopal Church on Southeast Cass Avenue. It will...

entry.title: DFPA DEALS WITH TWO SMALL FIRES ON MONDAY
entry.summary: August 26, 2025 3:50 a.m. Crews with the Douglas Forest Protective Association dealt with two small fires on Monday. A DFPA social media post said there were a few lightning strikes on DFPA protected lands. The first fire was estimated at 0.01 of an acre and was in timber about 13.5 miles northeast of Oakland....

entry.summary: August 26, 2025 3:40 a.m. The 110th H.O.P.E. Drug Court Graduation is happening on Tuesday night. entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 8.25.25
entry.summary: Judge Robert Johnson is joined by Curtis “Wall Street: Carroll who told story of being incarcerated for 27 years, and his work while in prison to learn financial literacy and now be able to share it was others. Judge Johnson also talked about the Drug Court program and its impact.

entry.title: Roseburg house fire cause under investigation
entry.summary: Fire officials said that the cause of a fire that severely damaged a Roseburg home on Sunday morning is currently under investigation, according to the Roseburg Fire Department.

entry.title: Umpqua National Forest sees multiple fires start
entry.summary: Umpqua National Forest — The U.S. Forest Service announced multiple reports of new fires in the north zone of the forest due to a widespread lightening storm on Aug. 24.

entry.title: Staying safe in the heat
entry.summary: Summers are getting hotter, and deadly heat related illnesses like heat stroke are becoming more common. Last summer, 11 people in Oregon died during of the July 4-7 heat wave — one of the most deadly weather events in Oregon’s…

entry.summary: ROSEBURG — A residential structure in west Roseburg sustained significant structural, smoke and water damage in a fire early Sunday morning.

entry.title: ADAPT EARNS THRIVE UMPQUA WORKSITE CERTIFICATION
entry.summary: August 25, 2025 2:50 a.m. Adapt Integrated Health Care has officially been designated as a Certified Worksite by Thrive Umpqua, a recognition of its ongoing commitment to employee health and well-being. A Thrive Umpqua release said the recertification acknowledges Adapts’ dedication to fostering a healthier work environment, building upon initiatives that began with the Blue...

entry.title: Twisted Steel RC Hobby Shop Announces Store Closing
entry.summary: Twisted Steel RC Hobby Shop in Roseburg is closing its doors. The store confirmed it is going out of business, urging customers to use credits and warranties soon. A cash-only blowout sale with up to 50% off starts August 22, 2025. All sales final, no refunds or exchanges.

entry.title: Claire’s in Roseburg to Close on August 26
entry.summary: Claire’s in Roseburg, located at 780 NW Garden Valley Boulevard, Suite 100, will close on August 26, 2025. The closure is part of the retailer’s nationwide bankruptcy restructuring. Shoppers can expect liquidation sales until the final day, marking the end of a nostalgic local favorite.

entry.title: MYSTI HARDING LOCATED SAFE

Undersheriff Brad O’Dell said following up on tips from members of the community, deputies located 38-year-old Mysti Harding in a dispersed campsite in the 4000 block of Cow Creek Road. entry.title: ROSEBURG SETS RECORD HIGH TEMPERATURE FOR THE DATE ON SATURDAY
entry.summary: August 24, 2025 5:50 a.m. Roseburg set a new record high temperature for the date on Saturday. Data from the National Weather Service in Medford said the mercury reached 102 degrees at the Roseburg Regional Airport. The previous record high for August 23rd was 99 degrees, set in 1934. Roseburg may be close to seeing...

entry.title: HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH 8:00 P.M. SUNDAY
entry.summary: August 24, 2025 5:40 a.m. A Heat Advisory remains in effect through Sunday night at 8:00 p.m. in central Douglas County and its eastern foothills. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford said hot conditions with high temperatures of 95 to 100 degrees are expected. Overnight low temperatures will range between 55 and 65...

entry.title: SHERIFF’S OFFICE SEEKING MISSING WOMAN
entry.summary: August 23, 2025 4:20 p.m. The Douglas County Sheriff’s Office is seeking assistance in locating 38-year-old Mysti Blu Harding, who is considered a missing person. Undersheriff Brad O’Dell said Harding was last seen by a family member on July 17th. O’Dell said she failed to report to work on August 18th. Her employer received a...

entry.title: GOVERNOR OPENS APPLICATION PROCESS: JUDICIAL VACANCY IN DOUGLAS COUNTY
entry.summary: August 23, 2025 1:00 p.m. On Friday, Governor Tina Kotek announced that she is accepting applications for a judicial vacancy on the Douglas County Circuit Court. The vacancy was created by the passage of Senate Bill 95, which the Governor signed into law on July 24th. A release said the legislation adds judicial position in...

entry.title: RECORD TIES RECORD HIGH FOR THE DATE ON FRIDAY
entry.summary: August 23, 2025 6:50 a.m. Roseburg tied the record high for the date on Friday. entry.title: Adapt Integrated Health Care, community partners to host overdose awareness event
entry.summary: Douglas County is gearing up for its 3rd Annual International Overdose Awareness Day event on Saturday, Aug. 23, from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. at Stewart Park Pavilion.

entry.title: Roseburg library seeks public's input on book collection choices
entry.summary: Roseburg Public Library is seeking input from patrons to guide their collection development. They are focusing on expanding digital materials and large-print books.
